metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: 自民 316議席獲得 単独で3分の2超 中道は49議席【開票結果】
all.description: 衆議院選挙は、これまでに小選挙区、比例代表をあわせた465の全議席が確定しました。自民党は単独で衆議院全体の3分の2にあたる310議席を上回り316議席を獲得しました。これに対し野党側は、中道改革連合が選挙前の172から100議席以上減らし、49議席にとどまりました。各政党のすべての議席をお伝えしています。

all.headline: 衆院選比例 自民とみらいが名簿の候補者足りず 議席は他党に
all.description: 比例代表では、自民党が4つのブロックで、チームみらいが1つのブロックでそれぞれ、名簿に載せた候補者が足りなくなった結果、本来獲得できるはずだった議席数が減り、他の政党に割りふられました。

all.headline: フィギュア団体 日本が2大会連続の銀 ミラノ・コルティナ五輪
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケート団体は8日、決勝最後の種目、男子シングルのフリーが行われ、佐藤駿選手が自己ベストの得点をあげる演技で2位となりました。この結果、日本は総合成績で2大会連続の銀メダルを獲得しました。

all.headline: 日本海側中心に大雪 広い範囲で厳しい冷え込み 路面凍結に注意
all.description: 非常に強い寒気の影響などで、日本海側を中心に大雪となり、平年を大幅に上回る積雪となっている地域もあり、交通への影響や除雪作業中の事故などに十分注意してください。関東など、太平洋側の平地でも雪が残っているほか、9日朝は広い範囲で厳しい冷え込みとなっていて、路面の凍結による事故にも注意が必要です。

all.headline: 東海道新幹線で遅れ 東京駅と新大阪駅では「列車ホテル」も
all.description: 東海道新幹線は雪の影響で8日から9日未明にかけて一部の列車に遅れが出ました。JR東海は、目的地にたどりつけなかった乗客のため、東京駅と新大阪駅の各駅でいわゆる「列車ホテル」として新幹線の車両を休憩用に開放しているということです。東京駅の「列車ホテル」を利用した女性によりますと、女性が乗った車両は予定から1時間余り遅れ、9日午前0時50分ごろ東京駅に到着し、休憩する場所として別の車両を案内されたとい

all.headline: 自民が歴史的圧勝 中道 野田・斉藤両共同代表が辞意表明へ
all.description: 衆議院選挙で自民党が単独で3分の2を上回る議席を獲得し、歴史的な圧勝を収めたことを受けて、高市総理大臣は、公約に掲げた政策の実現を加速させる方針です。一方、中道改革連合は、選挙前から100議席以上減らして大敗し、野田・斉藤両共同代表は、9日の役員会で辞意を表明する考えです。

all.headline: 円相場1ドル＝157円台後半に 自民圧勝受け オセアニア外為市場
all.description: 週明けの9日のオセアニアの外国為替市場では円を売ってドルを買う動きが進み、円相場は一時1ドル＝157円台後半まで値下がりしました。衆議院選挙で自民党が圧勝したことで高市政権が積極財政の動きを一段と進めるのではないかという見方が出ています。

all.headline: Japan's comeback falls just short as U.S. takes team figure skating gold in Milan
all.description: Team Japan was nearly flawless on Sunday at the Milano Cortina Olympics, but Ilia Malinin had the last word.

all.headline: No lights, total immersion: Autechre’s 'pitch-black' Tokyo show
all.description: At Zepp DiverCity, Autechre stripped a Tokyo concert of sight, saturating the room with sound — and controversy.

all.headline: CRA's Noda and Saito signal resolve to keep fledgling party together
all.description: The Centrist Reform Alliance’s poor performance in Sunday’s Lower House election could force co-leaders Yoshihiko Noda and Tetsuo Saito to resign.

all.headline: LDP set for historic win in snap election
all.description: The LDP-led coalition with the Japan Innovation Party is almost certain to secure a two-thirds majority, projections show.

all.headline: Reelected governor, Osaka's Yoshimura eyes referendum on merging city's wards
all.description: Most members of the Osaka City Council are against holding another referendum after voters twice rejected the plan previously.

all.headline: Vonn's Olympic dream cut short by downhill crash
all.description: The American star had been trying to claim the fourth Olympic medal of her career despite suffering a ruptured ACL in her left knee just over a week ago.

all.headline: Russia says man suspected of shooting top general has been flown to Moscow from Dubai
all.description: Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alexeyev, deputy head of Russia's vast GRU military ​intelligence service, was shot three times on Friday.

all.headline: U.K. police probing Peter Mandelson search two properties
all.description: Mandelson criminal probe began after the government referred communications between the former envoy and the late pedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein

all.headline: Iran defies U.S. threats to insist on right to enrich uranium
all.description: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said that Tehran had little trust in Washington and even doubted that the U.S. side was taking renewed negotiations seriously.

all.headline: Malaysia draws first data center protest over pollution and water
all.description: The country is emblematic of growing social unease with data centers worldwide, despite their crucial role in powering the internet and ChatGPT searches.

all.headline: LDP Wins Historic Landslide Victory
all.description: The Liberal Democratic Party secured 316 seats, winning a historic landslide victory with the highest number of seats in its history.

all.headline: Ruling Coalition of LDP, JIP Secures Two-Thirds Majority, Enabling Re-passage of Bills in Lower House
all.description: The Liberal Democratic Party and the Japan Innovation Party have secured 310 seats in the House of Representatives, reaching a two-thirds majority of the total seats.

all.headline: LDP Secures ‘Absolute Majority,’ Enabling It to Dominate All Committee Chair Posts
all.description: The Liberal Democratic Party secured at least 261 seats in the House of Representatives election on Sunday, enabling the party to dominate all committee chairperson posts and also have a majority in a

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Tsubaki Miki Misses Medal in Women’s Snowboard Parallel Giant Slalom
all.description: Tsubaki Miki was eliminated in the quarterfinals of the women's snowboard parallel giant slalom final tournament on Sunday.

all.description: The Liberal Democratic Party looked certain to secure a single-party majority in the 51st House of Representatives election on Sunday, according to exit polls jointly conducted by The Yomiuri Shimbun,

all.description: The Yomiuri ShimbunTeam Mirai leader Takahiro Anno smiles at a press conference in Shinjuku Ward, Tokyo, on Sunday evening The Yomiuri Shimbun [posttime] JST, [postdate] Sanseito and Team Mirai

all.headline: Jun Azumi, a CRA Secretary General, Set to Lose in Single Seat Constituency
all.description: Jun Azumi, a secretary general of the Centrist Reform Alliance, is set to lose in the single-seat Miyagi Constituency No. 4 in the House of Representatives election.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Vonn Crashes Out of Women’s Downhill
all.description: CORTINA D’AMPEZZO, ‍Italy (Reuters) - U.S. skier Lindsey Vonn crashed out of the women’s Alpine skiing Olympic downhill on Sunday with the race halted as she received medical attention.

all.headline: Japan's PM Takaichi on course to win snap election by landslide
all.description: Her ruling coalition is set to clinch a decisive win, taking two-thirds of the seats in the House of Representatives.

all.headline: Christchurch shooter seeks to overturn guilty plea
all.description: Brenton Tarrant is serving a life sentence after murdering 51 people in the March 2019 attack on two mosques in New Zealand.

all.headline: The woman tasked with kicking Australian kids off social media
all.description: After decades working in the private tech industry, Julia Inman Grant now finds herself on the other side.

all.headline: Australia's opposition coalition reunites after row over hate-speech laws
all.description: The Nationals had split from the Liberals citing free speech concerns over laws brought in after the Bondi Beach attack.

all.headline: Alleged mastermind among four arrested after Pakistan mosque blast
all.description: The four are suspected of facilitating a suicide bombing that killed more than 30 people, Pakistan's interior minister said.

all.headline: S Korean crypto firm accidentally pays out $40bn in bitcoin
all.description: The company quickly realised its mistake and managed to recover virtually all the missing tokens from customers.

all.headline: At least 18 die in 'rat-hole' mine blast in India
all.description: Rescue operations are on as more people are feared trapped inside the mine, police say.

all.headline: Coin portrait of late Queen draws criticism in Australia
all.description: The Royal Australian Mint has defended the design of the coins, which mark 100 years since Queen Elizabeth II's birth.

all.headline: More than 30 killed in blast at Pakistan mosque, officials say
all.description: The attack, which took place during Friday prayers in the capital Islamabad, injured almost 170 people.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

competitors.headline: Thai PM claims election victory with conservatives well ahead of rivals

competitors.description: The Nationals had split from the Liberals citing free speech concerns over laws brought in after the Bondi Beach attack.

competitors.description: The four are suspected of facilitating a suicide bombing that killed more than 30 people, Pakistan's interior minister said.

competitors.description: Rescue operations are on as more people are feared trapped inside the mine, police say.

competitors.description: The Royal Australian Mint has defended the design of the coins, which mark 100 years since Queen Elizabeth II's birth.

competitors.description: The attack, which took place during Friday prayers in the capital Islamabad, injured almost 170 people.

competitors.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

primary.headline: 自民 316議席獲得 単独で3分の2超 中道は49議席【開票結果】
primary.description: 衆議院選挙は、これまでに小選挙区、比例代表をあわせた465の全議席が確定しました。自民党は単独で衆議院全体の3分の2にあたる310議席を上回り316議席を獲得しました。これに対し野党側は、中道改革連合が選挙前の172から100議席以上減らし、49議席にとどまりました。各政党のすべての議席をお伝えしています。

primary.headline: 衆院選比例 自民とみらいが名簿の候補者足りず 議席は他党に
primary.description: 比例代表では、自民党が4つのブロックで、チームみらいが1つのブロックでそれぞれ、名簿に載せた候補者が足りなくなった結果、本来獲得できるはずだった議席数が減り、他の政党に割りふられました。

primary.headline: フィギュア団体 日本が2大会連続の銀 ミラノ・コルティナ五輪
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケート団体は8日、決勝最後の種目、男子シングルのフリーが行われ、佐藤駿選手が自己ベストの得点をあげる演技で2位となりました。この結果、日本は総合成績で2大会連続の銀メダルを獲得しました。

primary.headline: 日本海側中心に大雪 広い範囲で厳しい冷え込み 路面凍結に注意
primary.description: 非常に強い寒気の影響などで、日本海側を中心に大雪となり、平年を大幅に上回る積雪となっている地域もあり、交通への影響や除雪作業中の事故などに十分注意してください。関東など、太平洋側の平地でも雪が残っているほか、9日朝は広い範囲で厳しい冷え込みとなっていて、路面の凍結による事故にも注意が必要です。

primary.headline: 東海道新幹線で遅れ 東京駅と新大阪駅では「列車ホテル」も
primary.description: 東海道新幹線は雪の影響で8日から9日未明にかけて一部の列車に遅れが出ました。JR東海は、目的地にたどりつけなかった乗客のため、東京駅と新大阪駅の各駅でいわゆる「列車ホテル」として新幹線の車両を休憩用に開放しているということです。東京駅の「列車ホテル」を利用した女性によりますと、女性が乗った車両は予定から1時間余り遅れ、9日午前0時50分ごろ東京駅に到着し、休憩する場所として別の車両を案内されたとい

primary.headline: 自民が歴史的圧勝 中道 野田・斉藤両共同代表が辞意表明へ
primary.description: 衆議院選挙で自民党が単独で3分の2を上回る議席を獲得し、歴史的な圧勝を収めたことを受けて、高市総理大臣は、公約に掲げた政策の実現を加速させる方針です。一方、中道改革連合は、選挙前から100議席以上減らして大敗し、野田・斉藤両共同代表は、9日の役員会で辞意を表明する考えです。

primary.headline: 円相場1ドル＝157円台後半に 自民圧勝受け オセアニア外為市場
primary.description: 週明けの9日のオセアニアの外国為替市場では円を売ってドルを買う動きが進み、円相場は一時1ドル＝157円台後半まで値下がりしました。衆議院選挙で自民党が圧勝したことで高市政権が積極財政の動きを一段と進めるのではないかという見方が出ています。

primary.headline: Japan's comeback falls just short as U.S. takes team figure skating gold in Milan
primary.description: Team Japan was nearly flawless on Sunday at the Milano Cortina Olympics, but Ilia Malinin had the last word.

primary.headline: No lights, total immersion: Autechre’s 'pitch-black' Tokyo show
primary.description: At Zepp DiverCity, Autechre stripped a Tokyo concert of sight, saturating the room with sound — and controversy.

primary.headline: CRA's Noda and Saito signal resolve to keep fledgling party together
primary.description: The Centrist Reform Alliance’s poor performance in Sunday’s Lower House election could force co-leaders Yoshihiko Noda and Tetsuo Saito to resign.

primary.headline: LDP set for historic win in snap election
primary.description: The LDP-led coalition with the Japan Innovation Party is almost certain to secure a two-thirds majority, projections show.

primary.headline: Reelected governor, Osaka's Yoshimura eyes referendum on merging city's wards
primary.description: Most members of the Osaka City Council are against holding another referendum after voters twice rejected the plan previously.

primary.headline: Vonn's Olympic dream cut short by downhill crash
primary.description: The American star had been trying to claim the fourth Olympic medal of her career despite suffering a ruptured ACL in her left knee just over a week ago.

primary.headline: Russia says man suspected of shooting top general has been flown to Moscow from Dubai
primary.description: Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alexeyev, deputy head of Russia's vast GRU military ​intelligence service, was shot three times on Friday.

primary.headline: U.K. police probing Peter Mandelson search two properties
primary.description: Mandelson criminal probe began after the government referred communications between the former envoy and the late pedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein

primary.headline: Iran defies U.S. threats to insist on right to enrich uranium
primary.description: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said that Tehran had little trust in Washington and even doubted that the U.S. side was taking renewed negotiations seriously.

primary.headline: Malaysia draws first data center protest over pollution and water
primary.description: The country is emblematic of growing social unease with data centers worldwide, despite their crucial role in powering the internet and ChatGPT searches.

primary.headline: LDP Wins Historic Landslide Victory
primary.description: The Liberal Democratic Party secured 316 seats, winning a historic landslide victory with the highest number of seats in its history.

primary.headline: Ruling Coalition of LDP, JIP Secures Two-Thirds Majority, Enabling Re-passage of Bills in Lower House
primary.description: The Liberal Democratic Party and the Japan Innovation Party have secured 310 seats in the House of Representatives, reaching a two-thirds majority of the total seats.

primary.headline: LDP Secures ‘Absolute Majority,’ Enabling It to Dominate All Committee Chair Posts
primary.description: The Liberal Democratic Party secured at least 261 seats in the House of Representatives election on Sunday, enabling the party to dominate all committee chairperson posts and also have a majority in a

primary.description: Tsubaki Miki was eliminated in the quarterfinals of the women's snowboard parallel giant slalom final tournament on Sunday.

screenshots.name: Takaichi Sanae
tweets:
I am sincerely grateful to President Donald J. Trump for his warm words.
I look forward to visiting the White House this spring and to continuing our work together to further strengthen the Japan–U.S. Alliance.
Our Alliance and friendship with the United States of America are

Today, we made a congratulatory phone call to Aoi Kimura, a snowboarder and men's big air skater who became the first TEAM JAPAN to win a gold medal at the Milan-Cortina Olympics.

This is a remarkable achievement, making him the first Japanese male to win a gold medal in this event.

Tomorrow is the voting day for the House of Representatives election.

For 12 days after the announcement, we traveled approximately 15,000 km to 47 locations in 23 prefectures, from Hokkaido in the north to Kagoshima Prefecture in the south, continuing to appeal to the Japanese archipelago with the slogan, "Make the Japanese archipelago strong and prosperous."
Today, I attended the "National Convention for the Return of the Northern Territories" and gave a speech.

自民党公認の「若宮けんじ」さんの応援で、東京都世田谷区に伺いました。
東京５区（世田谷区の一部）の皆様の「若宮けんじ」さんへの応援が、私、高市早苗の力になります。
「若宮けんじ」さんに、ぜひ一票をお託し下さい！

We will continue to deliver measures against high prices to Tokyo!
